alert.note: Alert for Lonoke; Prairie; Pulaski; Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 8:06AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Prairie, central Lonoke, east central Saline and eastern Pulaski Counties through 830 AM CDT... At 806 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Jacksonville to near Sweet Home to near Bryant. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Benton... Sherwood... Jacksonville... Cabot... West Little Rock... Bryant... Downtown Little Rock... Lonoke... North Little Rock Airport... Little Rock AFB... Southwest Little Rock... Ward... Shannon Hills... Carlisle... Wrightsville... Austin in Lonoke County... Argenta... Keo... This includes the following highways... Interstate 30 between mile markers 122 and 142. Interstate 40 between mile markers 147 and 183. Interstate 430 between mile markers 1 and 8, and between mile markers 10 and 12. Interstate 530 between mile markers 1 and 13. Interstate 630 between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 440 between mile markers 1 and 14. US Highway 67 between mile markers 1 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
